alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 8:21PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall earlier today continues. * WHERE...A portion of Sonoma County near Forestville and southward just to the east of Sebastopol and to the west of Rohnert Park. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM PDT, The heaviest rainfall has ended across the area. However, Colgan Creek near Sebastopol and Green Valley Creek at Martinelli Road are currently in minor flood stage. Additionally, Mark West Creek near Mirabel Heights is in monitor stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Sebastopol, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads, especially at night.
